title: Caregiver, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was remote through zoom. They got back to me within 2 weeks of applying, and was offered within 2 weeks after my interview. Process was relatively easy and the interview was 1:1
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were busy and feeling stressed at work and how did you handle the situation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Hr called me to screen Interview set up for in person interview In person panel interview with charge nurse, manager, director Got offer 2 days later via email by HR
Interview Questions: Why USC Describe a time you felt uncomfortable with a doctor's orders

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview in September 2020. I interviewed with a gentleman who asked me some pretty straight forward questions. Then I was asked to stay for another round of interviews. I interviewed with three other managers who were all very nice. I was called for a pharmacology exam the next week.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (La Canada Flintridge, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied in August and interviewed in September. The interview was with multiple managers and one director for Med/Surg, TCU, and Tele. There were two rounds of interviews and then I was called in to take a pharmacology test the following week.
Interview Questions: What are the three most important nursing roles

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were employees from different units. You are asked to approach them. Ever table asks from 4-6 questions. Mostly behavioral questions, or  questions about past experience. There were questions how to prioritize as well.  They are very nice
Interview Questions: What problem you had and how you overcomed?

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly laid back and basic. Everything was on time and as scheduled. I met with the Lab Manager at the time and he was very kind and respectable. He put my worries at ease and gave a tour of the lab. Employees were all nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: What made you want to me an MLT?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Overall great experience. Very friendly manager, also I got a chance to meet the unit staff.  Interview went great overall, currently waiting on the offer.  Hopefully will get it in the next week or so.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Patient Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Great interview!!! I enjoyed meeting with the two ladies, they asked basic questions tell me about your last jobs, do you know about this job, when have you not gotten along with an employee .   
But for USC here's the note for you,
Here's were it's concerning the pay is $14 an hour!!! UCLA pays almost $7 more.  We are in Southern California there's no way someone can live off of $14 an hour.   I declined the job right away.  If USC decides to do a pay huge raise I wouldn't mind going back to work with those ladies!!!
Interview Questions: What do you know about this position?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place with Director, Unit manager, and clinical manager. Responded well to bringing a portfolio, used it to guide questions specific to area of interest and experience. Each interviewer asked questions related to their purview and all asked questions that let them know how I would fit into the facility/unit culture.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. Do you see yourself remaining in this specialty?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at USC Verdugo Hills Hospital (Glendale, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reviews applications.Assessment.Hiring manager interview.Back ground checks.
Interview Questions: what do you find most rewarding about being a nurse?
